page.title: 01INTRODUCTION BANBRIDGE
page.content: Banbridge is one of the most prosperous and attractive towns in Northern Ireland.Since 1971 it has experienced the fastest growth rate in the province.The population in 1985 is approximately 10,500. The town is a mixture of all three sectors of the economy blended with residential areas.While industries such as Down Shoes provide employment many people commute to Belfast. The town centre has excellent modern shops and is well provided with banks and other commercial offices. The most striking feature for the visitor must be the "CUT" a mid 19th century bridge which some claim was Ireland's first flyover.The town centre has many attractive 19th century buildings which unfortunately have been defaced by ugly modern shop fronts.
